lead_paragraph: To the extent that they succeed in finding work at all, older people are likely to find themselves in certain types of jobs.

headline.print_headline: As More Older People Look for Work, They Are Put Into ‘Old Person Jobs’
headline.main: More Older People Are Finding Work, but What Kind?

snippet: To the extent that they succeed in finding work at all, older people are likely to find themselves in certain types of jobs....
abstract: The Upshot; study by economist Matthew Rutledge at Boston College's Center for Retirement Research shows that many older American workers looking for employment find they are limited to so-called old-person jobs, most of which are lower-skilled service jobs.
